Project Title: Can We Reduce N and Improve ROI?
Notes: LATE Spring due to wet & cold. Burndown/pre-emerge applied on a VERY hot day. Could notice the impact of the spray within a couple hours (agronomist said it was the 32% more than the glyphosate). Planting date was also later than desired due to spring rains & cold. Pattern tiling was helpful in this field.

Project Title: Can We Reduce N and Improve ROI?
Notes: After lots of conversation with agronomist & other advisers with cover crop experience, I cut down significantly on the time between the rye burndown & planting date (only 5 days). Did this because of the late date AND because the burndown appeared to act relatively quickly

Project Title: Can We Reduce N and Improve ROI?
Notes: even though it created a negative profitability impact for me, I very much appreciate having a better sense of the appropriateness of my N applications.
